text: <a href="../1-Timothy-6-1/" title="1 Timothy 6:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and *his* doctrine be not blasphemed.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-2/" title="1 Timothy 6:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And they that have believing masters, let them not despise *them*, because they are brethren; but rather do *them* service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-3/" title="1 Timothy 6:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 If any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words, *even* the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-4/" title="1 Timothy 6:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 He is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-5/" title="1 Timothy 6:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.
<a href="../1-Timothy-6-6/" title="1 Timothy 6:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 But godliness with contentment is great gain.
<a href="../1-Timothy-6-7/" title="1 Timothy 6:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 For we brought nothing into *this* world, *and it is* certain we can carry nothing out.
<a href="../1-Timothy-6-8/" title="1 Timothy 6:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-9/" title="1 Timothy 6:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and *into* many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-10/" title="1 Timothy 6:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-11/" title="1 Timothy 6:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 But thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-12/" title="1 Timothy 6:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-13/" title="1 Timothy 6:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 I give thee charge in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, and *before* Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession;

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-14/" title="1 Timothy 6:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 That thou keep *this* commandment without spot, unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-15/" title="1 Timothy 6:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 Which in his times he shall shew, *who is* the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-16/" title="1 Timothy 6:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 Who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom *be* honour and power everlasting. Amen.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-17/" title="1 Timothy 6:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-18/" title="1 Timothy 6:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-19/" title="1 Timothy 6:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-20/" title="1 Timothy 6:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profane *and* vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:

<a href="../1-Timothy-6-21/" title="1 Timothy 6:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 Which some professing have erred concerning the faith. Grace *be* with thee. Amen. (*The first to Timothy was written from Laodicea, which is the chiefest city of Phrygia Pacatiana.*)
